fields.description: Address/Command Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDLs on address and command signals.
fields.name: ACBD

fields.description: CK2 Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on CK2.
fields.name: CK2BD

fields.description: CK1 Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on CK1.
fields.name: CK1BD

fields.description: CK0 Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on CK0.
fields.name: CK0BD

fields.description: Address/Command Slew Rate (D3F I/O Only): Selects slew rate of the I/O for all address and command pins.
fields.name: ACSR

fields.description: SDRAM Reset I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for SDRAM Reset.
fields.name: RSTIOM

fields.description: SDRAM Reset Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on the I/O for SDRAM RST# pin.
fields.name: RSTPDR

fields.description: SDRAM Reset Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for SDRAM RST# pin.
fields.name: RSTPDD

fields.description: SDRAM Reset On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for SDRAM RST# pin.
fields.name: RSTODT

fields.description: Rank Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on the I/O CKE[3:0],, ODT[3:0],, and CS#[3:0], pins. RANKPDR[0], controls the power down for CKE[0],, ODT[0],, and CS#[0],, RANKPDR[1], controls the power down for CKE[1],, ODT[1],, and CS#[1],, and so on.
fields.name: RANKPDR

fields.description: CS# Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for CS#[3:0], pins. CSPDD[0], controls the power down for CS#[0],, CSPDD[1], controls the power down for CS#[1],, and so on. CKE and ODT driver power down is controlled by DSGCR register.
fields.name: CSPDD

fields.description: Rank On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for CKE[3:0],, ODT[3:0],, and CS#[3:0], pins. RANKODT[0], controls the on-die termination for CKE[0],, ODT[0],, and CS#[0],, RANKODT[1], controls the on-die termination for CKE[1],, ODT[1],, and CS#[1],, and so on.
fields.name: RANKODT

fields.description: CK Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on the I/O for CK[0],, CK[1],, and CK[2], pins, respectively.
fields.name: CKPDR

fields.description: CK Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for CK[0],, CK[1],, and CK[2], pins, respectively.
fields.name: CKPDD

fields.description: CK On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for CK[0],, CK[1],, and CK[2], pins, respectively.
fields.name: CKODT

fields.description: AC Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on the I/O for RAS#, CAS#, WE#, BA[2:0],, and A[15:0], pins.
fields.name: ACPDR

fields.description: AC Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for RAS#, CAS#, WE#, BA[2:0],, and A[15:0], pins.
fields.name: ACPDD

fields.description: Address/Command On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for RAS#, CAS#, WE#, BA[2:0],, and A[15:0], pins.
fields.name: ACODT

fields.description: Address/Command Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver on the I/O for all address and command pins.
fields.name: ACOE

fields.description: Address/Command I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for all address and command pins. This bit connects to bit [0], of the IOM pin on the D3F I/Os, and for other I/O libraries, it connects to the IOM pin of the I/O.
fields.name: ACIOM

fields.description: MDL Delay: Delay select for the LCDL for the Master Delay Line.
fields.name: MDLD

fields.description: Target Period: Target period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This is the current measured value of the period and is continuously updated if the MDL is enabled to do so.
fields.name: TPRD

fields.description: Initial Period: Initial period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This value is used as the denominator when calculating the ratios of updates during VT compensation.
fields.name: IPRD

fields.description: BIST Bank Address: Selects the SDRAM bank address to be used during BIST.
fields.name: BBANK

fields.description: BIST Row Address: Selects the SDRAM row address to be used during BIST.
fields.name: BROW

fields.description: BIST Column Address: Selects the SDRAM column address to be used during BIST. The lower bits of this address must be "0000" for BL16, "000" for BL8, "00" for BL4 and "0" for BL2.
fields.name: BCOL

fields.description: BIST Address Increment: Selects the value by which the SDRAM address is incremented for each write/read access. This value must be at the beginning of a burst boundary, i.e. the lower bits must be "0000" for BL16, "000" for BL8, "00" for BL4 and "0" for BL2.
fields.name: BAINC

fields.description: BIST Maximum Rank: Specifies the maximum SDRAM rank to be used during BIST. The default value is set to maximum ranks minus 1. Example default shown here is for a 4-rank system
fields.name: BMRANK

fields.description: BIST Rank: Selects the SDRAM rank to be used during BIST. Valid values range from 0 to maximum ranks minus 1.
fields.name: BRANK

fields.description: BIST Maximum Bank Address: Specifies the maximum SDRAM bank address to be used during BIST before the address increments to the next rank.
fields.name: BMBANK

fields.description: BIST Maximum Row Address: Specifies the maximum SDRAM row address to be used during BIST before the address increments to the next bank.
fields.name: BMROW

fields.description: BIST Maximum Column Address: Specifies the maximum SDRAM column address to be used during BIST before the address increments to the next row.
fields.name: BMCOL

fields.description: Address Bit Error: Each group of two bits indicate the bit error count on each of the up to 16 address bits. [1:0], is the error count for A[0],, [3:2], for A[1],, and so on.
fields.name: ABER

fields.description: ODT Bit Error: Each group of two bits indicates the bit error count on each of the up to 4 ODT bits. [1:0], is the error count for ODT[0],, [3:2], for ODT[1],, and so on.
fields.name: ODTBER

fields.description: CS# Bit Error: Each group of two bits indicate the bit error count on each of the up to 4 CS# bits. [1:0], is the error count for CS#[0],, [3:2], for CS#[1],, and so on.
fields.name: CSBER

fields.description: CKE Bit Error: Each group of two bits indicate the bit error count on each of the up to 4 CKE bits. [1:0], is the error count for CKE[0],, [3:2], for CKE[1],, and so on.
fields.name: CKEBER

fields.description: WE# Bit Error: Indicates the number of bit errors on WE#.
fields.name: WEBER

fields.description: Bank Address Bit Error: Each group of two bits indicate the bit error count on each of the up to 3 bank address bits. [1:0], is the error count for BA[0],, [3:2], for BA[1],, and so on.
fields.name: BABER

fields.description:
Data Bit Error: The error count for even DQS cycles. The first 16 bits indicate the error count for the first data beat (i.e. the data driven out on DQ[7:0], on the rising edge of DQS). The second 16 bits indicate the error on the second data beat
(i.e. the error count of the data driven out on DQ[7:0], on the falling edge of DQS). For each of the 16-bit group, the first 2 bits are for DQ[0],, the second for DQ[1],, and so on.
fields.name: DQBER0

fields.description: Data Bit Error: The error count for odd DQS cycles. The first 16 bits indicate the error count for the first data beat (i.e. the data driven out on DQ[7:0], on the rising edge of DQS). The second 16 bits indicate the error on the second data beat (i.e. the error count of the data driven out on DQ[7:0], on the falling edge of DQS). For each of the 16-bit group, the first 2 bits are for DQ[0],, the second for DQ[1],, and so on.
fields.name: DQBER1

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for each of the up to 4 ODT bits.
fields.name: ODTWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for each of the up to 4 CS# bits.
fields.name: CSWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for each of the up to 4 CKE bits.
fields.name: CKEWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for the WE#.
fields.name: WEWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for each of the up to 3 bank address bits.
fields.name: BAWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for each of the up to 16 address bits.
fields.name: AWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for the data mask (DM) bit. DMWEBS [0], is for the first DM beat, DMWEBS [1], is for the second DM beat, and so on.
fields.name: DMWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for the CAS.
fields.name: CASWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for the RAS.
fields.name: RASWEBS

fields.description: Bit status during a word error for each of the 8 data (DQ) bits. The first 8 bits indicate the status of the first data beat (i.e. the status of the data driven out on DQ[7:0], on the rising edge of DQS). The second 8 bits indicate the status of the second data beat (i.e. the status of the data driven out on DQ[7:0], on the falling edge of DQS), and so on. For each of the 8-bit group, the first bit is for DQ[0],, the second bit is for DQ[1],, and so on.
fields.name: DQWEBS

fields.description: CAS Bit Error: Indicates the number of bit errors on CAS.
fields.name: CASBER

fields.description: RAS Bit Error: Indicates the number of bit errors on RAS.
fields.name: RASBER

fields.description: DM Bit Error: Indicates the number of bit errors on data mask (DM) bit. DMBER[1:0], are for even DQS cycles first DM beat, and DMBER[3:2], are for even DQS cycles second DM beat. Similarly, DMBER[5:4], are for odd DQS cycles first DM beat, and DMBER[7:6], are for odd DQS cycles second DM beat.
fields.name: DMBER

fields.description: BIST Data Error: indicates if set that there is a data comparison error in the byte lane.
fields.name: BDXERR

fields.description: BIST Address/Command Error: indicates if set that there is a data comparison error in the address/command lane.
fields.name: BACERR

fields.description: BIST Done: Indicates if set that the BIST has finished executing. This bit is reset to zero when BIST is triggered.
fields.name: BDONE

fields.description: LFSR seed for pseudo-random BIST patterns.
fields.name: SEED

fields.description: Mask bit for each of the up to 4 ODT bits.
fields.name: ODTMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for each of the up to 4 CS# bits.
fields.name: CSMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for each of the up to 4 CKE bits.
fields.name: CKEMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for the WE#.
fields.name: WEMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for each of the up to 3 bank address bits.
fields.name: BAMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for each of the up to 16 address bits.
fields.name: AMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for the data mask (DM) bit.
fields.name: DMMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for the PAR_IN. Only for DIMM parity support and only if the design is compiled for less than 3 ranks.
fields.name: PARMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for the CAS.
fields.name: CASMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for the RAS.
fields.name: RASMSK

fields.description: Mask bit for each of the 8 data (DQ) bits.
fields.name: DQMSK

fields.description: BIST Clock Cycle Select: Selects the clock numbers on which the AC loopback data is written into the FIFO. Data is written into the loopback FIFO once every four clock cycles. Valid values are:
fields.name: BCCSEL

fields.description: BIST CK Select: Selects the CK that should be used to register the AC loopback signals from the I/Os. Valid values are:
fields.name: BCKSEL

fields.description: BIST DATX8 Select: Select the byte lane for comparison of loopback/read data. Valid values are 0 to 8.
fields.name: BDXSEL

fields.description: BIST Data Pattern Selects the data pattern used during BIST. Valid values are:
fields.name: BDPAT

fields.description: BIST Data Mask Enable: Enables if set that the data mask BIST should be included in the BIST run, i.e. data pattern generated and loopback data compared. This is valid only for loopback mode.
fields.name: BDMEN

fields.description: BIST AC Enable: Enables the running of BIST on the address/command lane PHY. This bit is exclusive with BDXEN, i.e. both cannot be set to '1' at the same time.
fields.name: BACEN

fields.description: BIST DATX8 Enable: Enables the running of BIST on the data byte lane PHYs. This bit is exclusive with BACEN, i.e. both cannot be set to '1' at the same time.
fields.name: BDXEN

fields.description: BIST Stop On Nth Fail: Specifies if set that the BIST should stop when an nth data word or address/command comparison error has been encountered.
fields.name: BSONF

fields.description: Number of Failures: Specifies the number of failures after which the execution of commands and the capture of read data should stop if BSONF bit of this register is set. Execution of commands and the capture of read data will stop after (NFAIL+1) failures if BSONF is set.
fields.name: NFAIL

fields.description: BIST Infinite Run: Specifies if set that the BIST should be run indefinitely until when it is either stopped or a failure has been encountered. Otherwise BIST is run until number of BIST words specified in the BISTWCR register has been generated.
fields.name: BINF

fields.description: BIST Mode Selects the mode in which BIST is run. Valid values are:
fields.name: BMODE

fields.description: BIST Instruction: Selects the BIST instruction to be executed: Valid values are:
fields.name: BINST

fields.description: BIST User Data Pattern 1: Data to be applied on odd DQ pins during BIST.
fields.name: BUDP1

fields.description: BIST User Data Pattern 0: Data to be applied on even DQ pins during BIST.
fields.name: BUDP0

fields.description: BIST Word Count: Indicates the number of words to generate during BIST. This must be a multiple of DRAM burst length (BL) divided by 2, e.g. for BL=8, valid values are 4, 8, 12, 16, and so on.
fields.name: BWCNT

fields.description: Byte Word Count: Indicates the number of words received from the byte lane.
fields.name: DXWCNT

fields.description: Address/Command Word Count: Indicates the number of words received from the address/command lane.
fields.name: ACWCNT

fields.description: Byte Word Error: Indicates the number of word errors on the byte lane. An error on any bit of the data bus including the data mask bit increments the error count.
fields.name: DXWER

fields.description: Address/Command Word Error: Indicates the number of word errors on the address/command lane. An error on any bit of the address/command bus increments the error count.
fields.name: ACWER

fields.description: Un-buffered DIMM Address Mirroring: Indicates if set that there is address mirroring on the second rank of an un-buffered DIMM (the rank connected to CS#[1],). In this case, the PUB re-scrambles the bank and address when sending mode register commands to the second rank. This only applies to PUB internal SDRAM transactions. Transactions generated by the controller must make its own adjustments when using an un-buffered DIMM. DCR[NOSRA], must be set if address mirroring is enabled.
fields.name: UDIMM

fields.description: DDR 2T Timing: Indicates if set that 2T timing should be used by PUB internally generated SDRAM transactions.
fields.name: DDR2T

fields.description: No Simultaneous Rank Access: Specifies if set that simultaneous rank access on the same clock cycle is not allowed. This means that multiple chip select signals should not be asserted at the same time. This may be required on some DIMM systems.
fields.name: NOSRA

fields.description:
Byte Mask: Mask applied to all beats of read data on all bytes lanes during read DQS gate training. This allows training to be conducted based on selected bit(s) from the byte lanes.
Note that this mask applies in DDR3 MPR operation mode as well and must be in keeping with the PDQ field setting.
fields.name: BYTEMASK

fields.description: Multi-Purpose Register (MPR) DQ (DDR3 Only): Specifies the value that is driven on non-primary DQ pins during MPR reads. Valid values are:
fields.name: MPRDQ

fields.description: Primary DQ (DDR3 Only): Specifies the DQ pin in a byte that is designated as a primary pin for Multi-Purpose Register (MPR) reads. Valid values are 0 to 7 for DQ[0], to DQ[7],, respectively.
fields.name: PDQ

fields.description: DDR 8-Bank: Indicates if set that the SDRAM used has 8 banks. tRPA = tRP+1 and tFAW are used for 8-bank DRAMs, other tRPA = tRP and no tFAW is used. Note that a setting of 1 for DRAMs that have fewer than 8 banks still results in correct functionality but less tighter DRAM command spacing for the parameters described here.
fields.name: DDR8BNK

fields.description: DDR Mode: SDRAM DDR mode. Valid values are:
fields.name: DDRMD

fields.description: Access Type: Specifies the type of access to be performed using this address. Valid values are:
fields.name: ATYPE

fields.description: Increment Address: Specifies, if set, that the cache address specified in WADDR and SADDR should be automatically incremented after each access of the cache. The increment happens in such a way that all the slices of a selected word are first accessed before going to the next word.
fields.name: INCA

fields.description: Cache Select: Selects the cache to be accessed. Valid values are:
fields.name: CSEL

fields.description: Cache Slice Address: Address of the cache slice to be accessed.
fields.name: CSADDR

fields.description: Cache Word Address: Address of the cache word to be accessed.
fields.name: CWADDR

fields.description: Cache Data: Data to be written to or read from a cache. This data corresponds to the cache word slice specified by the DCU Address Register.
fields.name: CDATA

fields.description: Read Capture Start Word: The capture and compare of read data should start after Nth word. For example setting this value to 12 will skip the first 12 read data.
fields.name: RCSW

fields.description: Expected Data Loop End Address: The last expected data cache word address that contains valid expected data. Expected data should looped between 0 and this address.
fields.name: XLEADDR

fields.description: Increment DRAM Address: Indicates if set that DRAM addresses should be incremented every time a DRAM read/write command inside the loop is executed.
fields.name: IDA

fields.description: Loop Infinite: Indicates if set that the loop should be executed indefinitely until stopped by the STOP command. Otherwise the loop is execute LCNT times.
fields.name: LINF

fields.description: Loop Count: The number of times that the loop should be executed if LINF is not set.
fields.name: LCNT

fields.description: Loop End Address: Command cache word address where the loop should end.
fields.name: LEADDR

fields.description: Loop Start Address: Command cache word address where the loop should start.
fields.name: LSADDR

fields.description: Expected Compare Enable: Indicates if set that read data coming back from the SDRAM should be should be compared with the expected data.
fields.name: XCEN

fields.description: Read Capture Enable: Indicates if set that read data coming back from the SDRAM should be captured into the read data cache.
fields.name: RCEN

fields.description: Stop Capture On Full: Specifies if set that the capture of read data should stop when the capture cache is full.
fields.name: SCOF

fields.description: Stop On Nth Fail: Specifies if set that the execution of commands and the capture of read data should stop when there are N read data failures. The number of failures is specified by NFAIL. Otherwise commands execute until the end of the program or until manually stopped using a STOP command.
fields.name: SONF

fields.description:
Number of Failures: Specifies the number of failures after which the execution of commands and the capture of read data should stop if SONF bit of this register is set. Execution of commands and the capture of read data will stop after (NFAIL+1) failures if SONF is set.
Valid values are from 0 to 254.
fields.name: NFAIL

fields.description: End Address: Cache word address where the execution of command should end.
fields.name: EADDR

fields.description: Start Address: Cache word address where the execution of commands should begin.
fields.name: SADDR

fields.description: DCU Instruction: Selects the DCU command to be executed: Valid values are:
fields.name: DINST

fields.description: Capture Full: Indicates if set that the capture cache is full.
fields.name: CFULL

fields.description: Capture Fail: Indicates if set that at least one read data word has failed.
fields.name: CFAIL

fields.description: Run Done: Indicates if set that the DCU has finished executing the commands in the command cache. This bit is also set to indicate that a STOP command has successfully been executed and command execution has stopped.
fields.name: RDONE

fields.description: Loop Count: Indicates the value of the loop count. This is useful when the program has stopped because of failures to assess how many reads were executed before first fail.
fields.name: LPCNT

fields.description: Fail Count: Number of read words that have failed.
fields.name: FLCNT

fields.description: Read Count: Number of read words returned from the SDRAM.
fields.name: RDCNT

fields.description: DCU Generic Timing Parameter 3.
fields.name: tDCUT3

fields.description: DCU Generic Timing Parameter 2.
fields.name: tDCUT2

fields.description: DCU Generic Timing Parameter 1.
fields.name: tDCUT1

fields.description: DCU Generic Timing Parameter 0.
fields.name: tDCUT0

fields.description: SDRAM CKE Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver on the I/O for SDRAM CKE pins.
fields.name: CKEOE

fields.description: SDRAM Reset Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver on the I/O for SDRAM RST# pin.
fields.name: RSTOE

fields.description: SDRAM ODT Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver on the I/O for SDRAM ODT pins.
fields.name: ODTOE

fields.description: SDRAM CK Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver on the I/O for SDRAM CK/CK# pins.
fields.name: CKOE

fields.description: ODT Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for ODT[3:0], pins. ODTPDD[0], controls the power down for ODT[0],, ODTPDD[1], controls the power down for ODT[1],, and so on.
fields.name: ODTPDD

fields.description: CKE Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for CKE[3:0], pins. CKEPDD[0], controls the power down for CKE[0],, CKEPDD[1], controls the power down for CKE[1],, and so on.
fields.name: CKEPDD

fields.description: Single Data Rate Mode: Indicates if set that the external controller is configured to run in single data rate (SDR) mode. Otherwise if not set the controller is running in half data rate (HDR) mode. This bit not supported in the current version of the PUB.
fields.name: SDRMODE

fields.description: Rise-to-Rise Mode: Indicates if set that the PHY mission mode is configured to run in rise-to-rise mode. Otherwise if not set the PHY mission modeis running in rise-to- fall mode.
fields.name: RRMODE

fields.description: ATO Analog Test Enable: Enables, if set, the analog test output (ATO) I/O.
fields.name: ATOAE

fields.description: DTO Output Enable: Enables, when set, the output driver on the I/O for DTO pins.
fields.name: DTOOE

fields.description: DTO I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for DTO pins.
fields.name: DTOIOM

fields.description: DTO Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on the I/O for DTO pins.
fields.name: DTOPDR

fields.description: DTO Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on the I/O for DTO pins.
fields.name: DTOPDD

fields.description: DTO On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for DTO pins.
fields.name: DTOODT

fields.description: PHY Update Acknowledge Delay: Specifies the number of clock cycles that the indication for the completion of PHY update from the PHY to the controller should be delayed. This essentially delays, by this many clock cycles, the de-assertion of dfi_ctrlup_ack and dfi_phyupd_req signals relative to the time when the delay lines or I/Os are updated.
fields.name: PUAD

fields.description: Bypass Rise-to-Rise Mode: Indicates if set that the PHY bypass mode is configured to run in rise-to-rise mode. Otherwise if not set the PHY bypass mode is running in rise-to-fall mode.
fields.name: BRRMODE

fields.description: DQS Gate Extension: Specifies if set that the DQS gating must be extended by two DRAM clock cycles and then re-centered, i.e. one clock cycle extension on either side.
fields.name: DQSGX

fields.description: Controller Update Acknowledge Enable: Specifies, if set, that the PHY should issue controller update acknowledge when the DFI controller update request is asserted. By default the PHY does not acknowledge controller initiated update requests but simply does an update whenever there is a controller update request. This speeds up the update.
fields.name: CUAEN

fields.description: Low Power PLL Power Down: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to the DFI low power opportunity request and power down the PLL of the byte if the wakeup time request satisfies the PLL lock time.
fields.name: LPPLLPD

fields.description: Low Power I/O Power Down: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to the DFI low power opportunity request and power down the I/Os of the byte.
fields.name: LPIOPD

fields.description:
Impedance Update Enable: Specifies, if set, that in addition to DDL VT update, the PHY could also perform impedance calibration (update).
Refer to the "Impedance Control Register 0-1 (ZQnCR0-1)" on page 104 bit fields DFICU0, DFICU1 and DFICCU bits to control if an impedance calibration is performed (update) with a DFI controller update request.
Refer to the "Impedance Control Register 0-1 (ZQnCR0-1)" on page 104 bit fields DFIPU0 and DFIPU1 bits to control if an impedance calibration is performed (update) with a DFI PHY update request.
fields.name: ZUEN

fields.description: Byte Disable Enable: Specifies if set that the PHY should respond to DFI byte disable request. Otherwise the byte disable from the DFI is ignored in which case bytes can only be disabled using the DXnGCR register.
fields.name: BDISEN

fields.description: PHY Update Request Enable: Specifies if set, that the PHY should issue PHY- initiated update request when there is DDL VT drift.
fields.name: PUREN

fields.description: Data Training Bank Address: Selects the SDRAM bank address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTBANK

fields.description: Data Training Row Address: Selects the SDRAM row address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTROW

fields.description: Data Training Column Address: Selects the SDRAM column address to be used during data training. The lower four bits of this address must always be "000".
fields.name: DTCOL

fields.description: Data Training Bank Address: Selects the SDRAM bank address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTBANK

fields.description: Data Training Row Address: Selects the SDRAM row address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTROW

fields.description: Data Training Column Address: Selects the SDRAM column address to be used during data training. The lower four bits of this address must always be "000".
fields.name: DTCOL

fields.description: Data Training Bank Address: Selects the SDRAM bank address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTBANK

fields.description: Data Training Row Address: Selects the SDRAM row address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTROW

fields.description: Data Training Column Address: Selects the SDRAM column address to be used during data training. The lower four bits of this address must always be "000".
fields.name: DTCOL

fields.description: Data Training Bank Address: Selects the SDRAM bank address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTBANK

fields.description: Data Training Row Address: Selects the SDRAM row address to be used during data training.
fields.name: DTROW

fields.description: Data Training Column Address: Selects the SDRAM column address to be used during data training. The lower four bits of this address must always be "000".
fields.name: DTCOL

fields.description: Refresh During Training: A non-zero value specifies that a burst of refreshes equal to the number specified in this field should be sent to the SDRAM after training each rank except the last rank.
fields.name: RFSHDT

fields.description: Rank Enable: Specifies the ranks that are enabled for data-training. Bit 0 controls rank 0, bit 1 controls rank 1, bit 2 controls rank 2, and bit 3 controls rank 3. Setting the bit to '1' enables the rank, and setting it to '0' disables the rank.
fields.name: RANKEN

fields.description: Data Training with Early/Extended Gate: Specifies if set that the DQS gate training should be performed with an early/extended gate as specified in DSGCR.DQSGX.
fields.name: DTEXG

fields.description: Data Training Extended Write DQS: Enables, if set, an extended write DQS whereby two additional pulses of DQS are added as post-amble to a burst of writes. Generally this should only be enabled when running read bit deskew with the intention of performing read eye deskew prior to running write leveling adjustment.
fields.name: DTEXD

fields.description: Data Training Debug Step: A write of 1 to this bit steps the data training algorithm through a single step. This bit is self-clearing.
fields.name: DTDSTP

fields.description: Data Training Debug Enable: Enables, if set, the data training debug mode.
fields.name: DTDEN

fields.description: Data Training Debug Byte Select: Selects the byte during data training debug mode.
fields.name: DTDBS

fields.description: Data Training WDQ Margin Override: If set the Training WDQ Margin value specified in DTCR[11:8], (DTWDQM) is used during data training. Otherwise the value is computed as of the ddr_clk period measurement found durig calibration of the WDQ LCDL.
fields.name: DTWDQMO

fields.description: Data Training Bit Deskew Centering: Enables, if set, eye centering capability during write and read bit deskew training.
fields.name: DTBDC

fields.description: Data Training Write Bit Deskew Data Mask. If set it enables write bit deskew of the data mask
fields.name: DTWBDDM

fields.description: Training WDQ Margin: Defines how close to 0 or how close to 2*(wdq calibration_value) the WDQ lcdl can be moved during training. Basically defines how much timing margin.
fields.name: DTWDQM

fields.description: Data Training Compare Data: Specifies, if set, that DQS gate training should also check if the returning read data is correct. Otherwise data-training only checks if the correct number of DQS edges were returned.
fields.name: DTCMPD

fields.description: Data Training Using MPR (DDR3 Only): Specifies, if set, that DQS gate training should use the SDRAM Multi-Purpose Register (MPR) register. Otherwise data- training is performed by first writing to some locations in the SDRAM and then reading them back.
fields.name: DTMPR

fields.description: Data Training Rank: Selects the SDRAM rank to be used during data bit deskew and eye centering.
fields.name: DTRANK

fields.description: Data Training Repeat Number: Repeat number used to confirm stability of DDR write or read
fields.name: DTRPTN

fields.description: Data Training Data: The second 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE3

fields.description: Data Training Data: The second 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE2

fields.description: Data Training Data: The second 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE1

fields.description: Data Training Data: The second 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE0

fields.description: Data Training Data: The first 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE7

fields.description: Data Training Data: The first 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE6

fields.description: Data Training Data: The first 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE5

fields.description: Data Training Data: The first 4 bytes of data used during data training. This same data byte is used for each Byte Lane. Default sequence is a walking 1 while toggling data every data cycle.
fields.name: DTBYTE4

fields.description: Data Training Write BDL Shift Maximum.
fields.name: DTWBMX

fields.description: Data Training Write BDL Shift Minimum.
fields.name: DTWBMN

fields.description: Data Training WDQ LCDL Maximum.
fields.name: DTWLMX

fields.description: Data Training WDQ LCDL Minimum.
fields.name: DTWLMN

fields.description: Data Training Read BDL Shift Maximum.
fields.name: DTRBMX

fields.description: Data Training Read BDL Shift Minimum.
fields.name: DTRBMN

fields.description: Data Training RDQS LCDL Maximum.
fields.name: DTRLMX

fields.description: Data Training RDQS LCDL Minimum.
fields.name: DTRLMN

fields.description: Activate to activate command delay (same bank). Valid values are 2 to 63.
fields.name: tRC

fields.description: Activate to activate command delay (different banks). Valid values are 1 to 15.
fields.name: tRRD

fields.description: Activate to precharge command delay. Valid values are 2 to 63.
fields.name: tRAS

fields.description: Activate to read or write delay. Minimum time from when an activate command is issued to when a read or write to the activated row can be issued. Valid values are 2 to 15.
fields.name: tRCD

fields.description: Precharge command period: The minimum time between a precharge command and any other command. Note that the Controller automatically derives tRPA for 8- bank DDR2_Devices by adding 1 to tRP. Valid values are 2 to 15.
fields.name: tRP

fields.description: Internal write to read command delay. Valid values are 1 to 15.
fields.name: tWTR

fields.description: Internal read to precharge command delay. Valid values are 2 to 15.
fields.name: tRTP

fields.description: ODT turn-on/turn-off delays (DDR2 only). The delays are in clock cycles. Most DDR2_Devices utilize a fixed value of 2/2.5. For non-standard SDRAMs, the user must ensure that the operational Write Latency is always greater than or equal to the ODT turn-on delay. For example, a DDR2 SDRAM with CAS latency set to 3 and CAS additive latency set to 0 has a Write Latency of 2. Thus 2/2.5 can be used, but not 3/3.5 or higher. Valid values are:
fields.name: tAOND_tAOFD

fields.description: Write leveling output delay: Number of clock cycles from when write leveling DQS is driven high by the control block to when the results from the SDRAM on DQ is sampled by the control block. This must include the SDRAM tWLO timing parameter plus the round trip delay from control block to SDRAM back to control block.
fields.name: tWLO

fields.description: Minimum delay from when write leveling mode is programmed to the first DQS/DQS# rising edge.
fields.name: tWLMRD

fields.description: Refresh-to-Refresh: Indicates the minimum time, in clock cycles, between two refresh commands or between a refresh and an active command. This is derived from the minimum refresh interval from the datasheet, tRFC(min), divided by the clock cycle time. The default number of clock cycles is for the largest JEDEC tRFC(min parameter value supported.
fields.name: tRFC

fields.description: 4-bank activate period. No more than 4-bank activate commands may be issued in a given tFAW period. Only applies to 8-bank devices. Valid values are 2 to 63.
fields.name: tFAW

fields.description: Load mode update delay (DDR3 only). The minimum time between a load mode register command and a non-load mode register command. Valid values are:
fields.name: tMOD

fields.description: Load mode cycle time: The minimum time between a load mode register command and any other command. For DDR3 this is the minimum time between two load mode register commands. Valid values for DDR2 are 2 to 3. For DDR3, the value used for tMRD is 4 plus the value programmed in these bits, i.e. tMRD value for DDR3 ranges from 4 to 7.
fields.name: tMRD

fields.description: Read to read and write to write command delay. Valid values are:
fields.name: tCCD

fields.description: Read to Write command delay. This parameter allows the user to increase the delay between issuing Write commands to the SDRAM when preceded by Read commands. This provides an option to increase bus turn-around margin for high frequency systems. Valid values are:
fields.name: tRTW

fields.description: Read to ODT delay (DDR3 only). Specifies whether ODT can be enabled immediately after the read post-amble or one clock delay has to be added. If tRTODT is set to 1, then the read-to-write latency is increased by 1 if ODT is enabled. Valid values are:
fields.name: tRTODT

fields.description: DLL locking time. Valid values are 2 to 1023.
fields.name: tDLLK

fields.description: CKE minimum pulse width. Also specifies the minimum time that the SDRAM must remain in power down or self refresh mode. For DDR3 this parameter must be set to the value of tCKESR which is usually bigger than the value of tCKE. Valid values are 2 to 15.
fields.name: tCKE

fields.description: Power down exit delay. The minimum time between a power down exit command and any other command. This parameter must be set to the maximum of the various minimum power down exit delay parameters specified in the SDRAM datasheet, i.e. max(tXP, tXARD, tXARDS) for DDR2 and max(tXP, tXPDLL) for DDR3. Valid values are 2 to 31.
fields.name: tXP

fields.description: Self refresh exit delay. The minimum time between a self refresh exit command and any other command. This parameter must be set to the maximum of the various minimum self refresh exit delay parameters specified in the SDRAM datasheet, i.e. max(tXSNR, tXSRD) for DDR2 and max(tXS, tXSDLL) for DDR3. Valid values are 2 to 1023.
fields.name: tXS

fields.description: DQ4 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ4 write path.
fields.name: DQ4WBD

fields.description: DQ3 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ3 write path.
fields.name: DQ3WBD

fields.description: DQ2 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ2 write path.
fields.name: DQ2WBD

fields.description: DQ1 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ1 write path.
fields.name: DQ1WBD

fields.description: DQ0 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ0 write path.
fields.name: DQ0WBD

fields.description: DQS Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQS write path.
fields.name: DSWBD

fields.description: DM Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DM write path.
fields.name: DMWBD

fields.description: DQ7 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ7 write path.
fields.name: DQ7WBD

fields.description: DQ6 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ6 write path.
fields.name: DQ6WBD

fields.description: DQ5 Write Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ5 write path.
fields.name: DQ5WBD

fields.description: DQSN Read Bit Delay (Type B/B1 PHY Only): Delay select for the BDL on DQSN read path
fields.name: DSNRBD

fields.description: DQS Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQS read path
fields.name: DSRBD

fields.description: DQ Output Enable Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ/DM output enable path.
fields.name: DQOEBD

fields.description: DQS Output Enable Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQS output enable path
fields.name: DSOEBD

fields.description: DQ4 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ4 read path.
fields.name: DQ4RBD

fields.description: DQ3 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ3 read path
fields.name: DQ3RBD

fields.description: DQ2 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ2 read path.
fields.name: DQ2RBD

fields.description: DQ1 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ1 read path.
fields.name: DQ1RBD

fields.description: DQ0 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ0 read path.
fields.name: DQ0RBD

fields.description: DM Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DM read path.
fields.name: DMRBD

fields.description: DQ7 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ7 read path.
fields.name: DQ7RBD

fields.description: DQ6 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ6 read path.
fields.name: DQ6RBD

fields.description: DQ5 Read Bit Delay: Delay select for the BDL on DQ5 read path.
fields.name: DQ5RBD

fields.description: Calibration Bypass: Prevents, if set, period measurement calibration from automatically triggering after PHY initialization.
fields.name: CALBYP

fields.description: Master Delay Line Enable: Enables, if set, the DATX8 master delay line calibration to perform subsequent period measurements following the initial period measurements that are performed after reset or when calibration is manually triggered. These additional measurements are accumulated and filtered as long as this bit remains high. This bit is ANDed with the common DATX8 MDL enable bit.
fields.name: MDLEN

fields.description: Write Level Rank Enable: Specifies the ranks that should be write leveled for this byte. Write leveling responses from ranks that are not enabled for write leveling for a particular byte are ignored and write leveling is flagged as done for these ranks. WLRKEN[0], enables rank 0, [1], enables rank 1, [2], enables rank 2, and [3], enables rank 3.
fields.name: WLRKEN

fields.description: PLL Bypass: Puts the byte PLL in bypass mode by driving the PLL bypass pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a '0' must be written to de-assert the bypass. This bit is ORed with the global BYP configuration bit (see Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: PLLBYP

fields.description: Gear Shift: Enables, if set, rapid locking mode on the byte PLL. This bit is ORed with the global GSHIFT configuration bit (see Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: GSHIFT

fields.description:
PLL Power Down: Puts the byte PLL in power down mode by driving the PLL power down pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a '0' must be written to de-assert the power-down. This bit is ORed with the global PLLPD configuration bit (see
Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: PLLPD

fields.description: PLL Rest: Resets the byte PLL by driving the PLL reset pin. This bit is not self- clearing and a '0' must be written to de-assert the reset. This bit is ORed with the global PLLRST configuration bit (see Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: PLLRST

fields.description: Data Byte Output Enable Override: Specifies whether the output I/O output enable for the byte lane should be set to a fixed value. Valid values are:
fields.name: DXOEO

fields.description: RTT On Additive Latency: Indicates when the ODT control of DQ/DQS SSTL I/Os is set to the value in DQODT/DQSODT during read cycles. Valid values are:
fields.name: RTTOAL

fields.description: RTT Output Hold: Indicates the number of clock cycles (from 0 to 3) after the read data postamble for which ODT control should remain set to DQSODT for DQS or DQODT for DQ/DM before disabling it (setting it to '0') when using dynamic ODT control. ODT is disabled almost RTTOH clock cycles after the read postamble.
fields.name: RTTOH

fields.description: DQ Dynamic RTT Control: Indicates, if set, that the ODT control of DQ/DM SSTL I/Os be dynamically controlled by setting it to the value in DQODT during reads and disabling it (setting it to '0') during any other cycle. If this bit is not set, then the ODT control of DQ SSTL I/Os is always set to the value in DQODT.
fields.name: DQRTT

fields.description: DQS Dynamic RTT Control: Indicates, if set, that the ODT control of DQS SSTL I/Os be dynamically controlled by setting it to the value in DQSODT during reads and disabling it (setting it to '0') during any other cycle. If this bit is not set, then the ODT control of DQS SSTL I/Os is always set to the value in DQSODT field.
fields.name: DQSRTT

fields.description: Write DQS Enable: Controls whether the write DQS going to the SDRAM is enabled (toggling) or disabled (static value) and whether the DQS is inverted. DQS# is always the inversion of DQS. These values are valid only when DQS/DQS# output enable is on, otherwise the DQS/DQS# is tristated. Valid settings are:
fields.name: DSEN

fields.description: DQSR Power Down: Powers down, if set, the PDQSR cell. This bit is ORed with the common PDR configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on page 68)
fields.name: DQSRPD

fields.description: Data Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common PDR configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on   page 68).
fields.name: DXPDR

fields.description: Data Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common PDD configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on   page 68).
fields.name: DXPDD

fields.description: Data I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the IOM configuration bit of the individual DATX8(see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on page 68).
fields.name: DXIOM

fields.description: Data On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for DQ and DM pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common DATX8 ODT configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on  page 68).
fields.name: DQODT

fields.description: DQS On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for DQS/DQS# pin of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common DATX8 ODT configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on   page 68).
fields.name: DQSODT

fields.description: Data Byte Enable: Enables if set the data byte. Setting this bit to '0' disables the byte, i.e. the byte is not used in PHY initialization or training and is ignored during SDRAM read/write operations.
fields.name: DXEN

fields.description: Write Leveling DQ Status: Captures the write leveling DQ status from the DRAM during software write leveling.
fields.name: WLDQ

fields.description: DQS Gate Training Error: Indicates if set that there is an error in DQS gate training. One bit for each of the up to 4 ranks.
fields.name: QSGERR

fields.description: Read DQS gating Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
fields.name: GDQSPRD

fields.description: DATX8 PLL Lock: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 PLL has locked. This is a direct status of the DATX8 PLL lock pin.
fields.name: DPLOCK

fields.description: Write Leveling Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the write leveling LCDL during calibration. The measured period is used to generate the control of the write leveling pipeline which is a function of the write-leveling delay and the clock period. This value is PVT compensated.
fields.name: WLPRD

fields.description: Write Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is a write leveling error in the DATX8.
fields.name: WLERR

fields.description: Write Leveling Done: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has completed write leveling.
fields.name: WLDONE

fields.description: Write Leveling Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write leveling slave delay line.
fields.name: WLCAL

fields.description: Read DQS gating Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating LCDL.
fields.name: GDQSCAL

fields.description: Read DQS# Calibration (Type B/B1 PHY Only): Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS# LCDL.
fields.name: RDQSNCAL

fields.description: Read DQS Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS LCDL.
fields.name: RDQSCAL

fields.description: Write DQ Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write DQ LCDL.
fields.name: WDQCAL

fields.description: Delay Line Test Code: Returns the code measured by the PHY control block that corresponds to the period of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
fields.name: DLTCODE

fields.description: Delay Line Test Done: Indicates, if set, that the PHY control block has finished doing period measurement of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
fields.name: DLTDONE

fields.description: Error Status: If an error occurred for this lane as indicated by RDERR, WDERR, REERR or WEERR the error status code can provide additional information regard when the error occurred during the algorithm execution.
fields.name: ESTAT

fields.description: Write Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write eye centering training.
fields.name: WEWN

fields.description: Write Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write eye centering training.
fields.name: WEERR

fields.description: Read Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read eye centering training.
fields.name: REWN

fields.description: Read Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read eye centering training.
fields.name: REERR

fields.description: Write Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write bit deskew training.
fields.name: WDWN

fields.description: Write Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write bit deskew training.
fields.name: WDERR

fields.description: Read Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read bit deskew training.
fields.name: RDWN

fields.description: Read Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read bit deskew training.
fields.name: RDERR

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R3WLSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R2WLSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R1WLSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R0WLSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:"
fields.name: R3DGSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
fields.name: R2DGSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
fields.name: R1DGSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
fields.name: R0DGSL

fields.description: Rank 3 Write Leveling Delay: Rank 3 delay select for the write leveling (WL) LCDL.
fields.name: R3WLD

fields.description: Rank 2 Write Leveling Delay: Rank 2_Delay select for the write leveling (WL) LCDL.
fields.name: R2WLD

fields.description: Rank 1 Write Leveling Delay: Rank 1_Delay select for the write leveling (WL) LCDL.
fields.name: R1WLD

fields.description: Rank 0 Write Leveling Delay: Rank 0 delay select for the write leveling (WL) LCDL.
fields.name: R0WLD

fields.description: Read DQSN Delay: Delay select for the read DQSN (RDQS) LCDL.
fields.name: RDQSND

fields.description: Read DQS Delay: Delay select for the read DQS (RDQS) LCDL.
fields.name: RDQSD

fields.description: Write Data Delay: Delay select for the write data (WDQ) LCDL.
fields.name: WDQD

fields.description: Rank 3 Read DQS Gating Delay: Rank 3 delay select for the read DQS gating (DQSG) LCDL.
fields.name: R3_DQSGD

fields.description: Rank 2 Read DQS Gating Delay: Rank 2_Delay select for the read DQS gating (DQSG) LCDL.
fields.name: R2_DQSGD

fields.description: Rank 1 Read DQS Gating Delay: Rank 1_Delay select for the read DQS gating (DQSG) LCDL.
fields.name: R1_DQSGD

fields.description: Rank 0 Read DQS Gating Delay: Rank 0 delay select for the read DQS gating (DQSG) LCDL.
fields.name: R0_DQSGD

fields.description: MDL Delay: Delay select for the LCDL for the Master Delay Line.
fields.name: MDLD

fields.description: Target Period: Target period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This is the current measured value of the period and is continuously updated if the MDL is enabled to do so.
fields.name: TPRD

fields.description: Initial Period: Initial period measured by the master delay line calibration for VT drift compensation. This value is used as the denominator when calculating the ratios of updates during VT compensation.
fields.name: IPRD

fields.description: Calibration Bypass: Prevents, if set, period measurement calibration from automatically triggering after PHY initialization.
fields.name: CALBYP

fields.description: Master Delay Line Enable: Enables, if set, the DATX8 master delay line calibration to perform subsequent period measurements following the initial period measurements that are performed after reset or when calibration is manually triggered. These additional measurements are accumulated and filtered as long as this bit remains high. This bit is ANDed with the common DATX8 MDL enable bit.
fields.name: MDLEN

fields.description: Write Level Rank Enable: Specifies the ranks that should be write leveled for this byte. Write leveling responses from ranks that are not enabled for write leveling for a particular byte are ignored and write leveling is flagged as done for these ranks. WLRKEN[0], enables rank 0, [1], enables rank 1, [2], enables rank 2, and [3], enables rank 3.
fields.name: WLRKEN

fields.description: PLL Bypass: Puts the byte PLL in bypass mode by driving the PLL bypass pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a '0' must be written to de-assert the bypass. This bit is ORed with the global BYP configuration bit (see Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: PLLBYP

fields.description: Gear Shift: Enables, if set, rapid locking mode on the byte PLL. This bit is ORed with the global GSHIFT configuration bit (see Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: GSHIFT

fields.description:
PLL Power Down: Puts the byte PLL in power down mode by driving the PLL power down pin. This bit is not self-clearing and a '0' must be written to de-assert the power-down. This bit is ORed with the global PLLPD configuration bit (see
Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: PLLPD

fields.description: PLL Rest: Resets the byte PLL by driving the PLL reset pin. This bit is not self- clearing and a '0' must be written to de-assert the reset. This bit is ORed with the global PLLRST configuration bit (see Table 3-10 on page 62).
fields.name: PLLRST

fields.description: Data Byte Output Enable Override: Specifies whether the output I/O output enable for the byte lane should be set to a fixed value. Valid values are:
fields.name: DXOEO

fields.description: RTT On Additive Latency: Indicates when the ODT control of DQ/DQS SSTL I/Os is set to the value in DQODT/DQSODT during read cycles. Valid values are:
fields.name: RTTOAL

fields.description: RTT Output Hold: Indicates the number of clock cycles (from 0 to 3) after the read data postamble for which ODT control should remain set to DQSODT for DQS or DQODT for DQ/DM before disabling it (setting it to '0') when using dynamic ODT control. ODT is disabled almost RTTOH clock cycles after the read postamble.
fields.name: RTTOH

fields.description: DQ Dynamic RTT Control: Indicates, if set, that the ODT control of DQ/DM SSTL I/Os be dynamically controlled by setting it to the value in DQODT during reads and disabling it (setting it to '0') during any other cycle. If this bit is not set, then the ODT control of DQ SSTL I/Os is always set to the value in DQODT.
fields.name: DQRTT

fields.description: DQS Dynamic RTT Control: Indicates, if set, that the ODT control of DQS SSTL I/Os be dynamically controlled by setting it to the value in DQSODT during reads and disabling it (setting it to '0') during any other cycle. If this bit is not set, then the ODT control of DQS SSTL I/Os is always set to the value in DQSODT field.
fields.name: DQSRTT

fields.description: Write DQS Enable: Controls whether the write DQS going to the SDRAM is enabled (toggling) or disabled (static value) and whether the DQS is inverted. DQS# is always the inversion of DQS. These values are valid only when DQS/DQS# output enable is on, otherwise the DQS/DQS# is tristated. Valid settings are:
fields.name: DSEN

fields.description: DQSR Power Down: Powers down, if set, the PDQSR cell. This bit is ORed with the common PDR configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on page 68)
fields.name: DQSRPD

fields.description: Data Power Down Receiver: Powers down, when set, the input receiver on I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common PDR configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on   page 68).
fields.name: DXPDR

fields.description: Data Power Down Driver: Powers down, when set, the output driver on I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common PDD configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on   page 68).
fields.name: DXPDD

fields.description: Data I/O Mode: Selects SSTL mode (when set to 0) or CMOS mode (when set to 1) of the I/O for DQ, DM, and DQS/DQS# pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the IOM configuration bit of the individual DATX8(see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on page 68).
fields.name: DXIOM

fields.description: Data On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for DQ and DM pins of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common DATX8 ODT configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on  page 68).
fields.name: DQODT

fields.description: DQS On-Die Termination: Enables, when set, the on-die termination on the I/O for DQS/DQS# pin of the byte. This bit is ORed with the common DATX8 ODT configuration bit (see "DATX8 Common Configuration Register (DXCCR)" on   page 68).
fields.name: DQSODT

fields.description: Data Byte Enable: Enables if set the data byte. Setting this bit to '0' disables the byte, i.e. the byte is not used in PHY initialization or training and is ignored during SDRAM read/write operations.
fields.name: DXEN

fields.description: Write Leveling DQ Status: Captures the write leveling DQ status from the DRAM during software write leveling.
fields.name: WLDQ

fields.description: DQS Gate Training Error: Indicates if set that there is an error in DQS gate training. One bit for each of the up to 4 ranks.
fields.name: QSGERR

fields.description: Read DQS gating Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the read DQS gating LCDL during calibration. This value is PVT compensated.
fields.name: GDQSPRD

fields.description: DATX8 PLL Lock: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 PLL has locked. This is a direct status of the DATX8 PLL lock pin.
fields.name: DPLOCK

fields.description: Write Leveling Period: Returns the DDR clock period measured by the write leveling LCDL during calibration. The measured period is used to generate the control of the write leveling pipeline which is a function of the write-leveling delay and the clock period. This value is PVT compensated.
fields.name: WLPRD

fields.description: Write Leveling Error: Indicates, if set, that there is a write leveling error in the DATX8.
fields.name: WLERR

fields.description: Write Leveling Done: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has completed write leveling.
fields.name: WLDONE

fields.description: Write Leveling Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write leveling slave delay line.
fields.name: WLCAL

fields.description: Read DQS gating Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS gating LCDL.
fields.name: GDQSCAL

fields.description: Read DQS# Calibration (Type B/B1 PHY Only): Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS# LCDL.
fields.name: RDQSNCAL

fields.description: Read DQS Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the read DQS LCDL.
fields.name: RDQSCAL

fields.description: Write DQ Calibration: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has finished doing period measurement calibration for the write DQ LCDL.
fields.name: WDQCAL

fields.description: Delay Line Test Code: Returns the code measured by the PHY control block that corresponds to the period of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
fields.name: DLTCODE

fields.description: Delay Line Test Done: Indicates, if set, that the PHY control block has finished doing period measurement of the DATX8 delay line digital test output.
fields.name: DLTDONE

fields.description: Error Status: If an error occurred for this lane as indicated by RDERR, WDERR, REERR or WEERR the error status code can provide additional information regard when the error occurred during the algorithm execution.
fields.name: ESTAT

fields.description: Write Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write eye centering training.
fields.name: WEWN

fields.description: Write Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write eye centering training.
fields.name: WEERR

fields.description: Read Eye Centering Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read eye centering training.
fields.name: REWN

fields.description: Read Eye Centering Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read eye centering training.
fields.name: REERR

fields.description: Write Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the write bit deskew training.
fields.name: WDWN

fields.description: Write Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the write bit deskew training.
fields.name: WDERR

fields.description: Read Bit Deskew Warning: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered a warning during execution of the read bit deskew training.
fields.name: RDWN

fields.description: Read Bit Deskew Error: Indicates, if set, that the DATX8 has encountered an error during execution of the read bit deskew training.
fields.name: RDERR

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R3WLSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R2WLSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R1WLSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R0WLSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:"
fields.name: R3DGSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
fields.name: R2DGSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
fields.name: R1DGSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
fields.name: R0DGSL

fields.description: Rank n Write Leveling System Latency: This is used to adjust the write latency after write leveling. Power-up default is 01 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic write leveling but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every two bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0WLSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1WLSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values:
fields.name: R3WLSL

fields.description: Rank n DQS Gating System Latency: This is used to increase the number of clock cycles needed to expect valid DDR read data by up to seven extra clock cycles. This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:"
fields.name: R3DGSL

This is used to compensate for board delays and other system delays. Power-up default is 000 (i.e. no extra clock cycles required). The SL fields are initially set by the PUB during automatic DQS data training but these values can be overwritten by a direct write to this register. Every three bits of this register control the latency of each of the (up to) four ranks. R0DGSL controls the latency of rank 0, R1DGSL controls rank 1, and so on. Valid values are 0 to 7:
